repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
A multi-text manuscript containing 59 works, mostly Śaiva (e.g. most of the Meykaṇṭa Cāttirams), following each other from one page to the other or on the same page, as follows:
the Tattuvāmirtam (U3, f1r-f11v = Indien 28.1).
the Aññāṉavataipparaṇi (U3, f12r-f37v = Indien 28.2).
the Tiruvuntiyār (U3, f38r-f39r11 = Indien 28.3).
the Tirukaḷiṟṟuppaṭiyār (U3, f39r11-f44v = Indien 28.4).
the Civañāṉapōtam (U3, f45r-f52r7 = Indien 28.5).
the Civappirakācam (U3, f52r7-f61r7 = Indien 28.6).
the Uṇmaineṟiviḷakkam (U3, f61r7-f61v9 = Indien 28.7).
the Irupāvirupatu (U3, f61v9-f65v5 = Indien 28.8).
the Tiruvaruṭpayaṉ (U3, f65v5-f68r6 = Indien 28.9).
the Caṅkaṟpanirākaraṇam (U3, f68r7-f80 = Indien 28.10).
the Viṉāveṇpā (U3, f81r-f81v6 = Indien 28.11).
the Neñcuviṭutūtu (U3, f81v6-f85v4 = Indien 28.12).
the Poṟṟippaḵṟoṭai (U3, f85v4-f88v5 = Indien 28.13).
the Tiruppāṇāṟṟuppaṭai (U3, f88v6-f91r = Indien 28.14).
the Pūcākāraṇam (U3, f91v-f93v = Indien 28.15).
the Tattuvaviḷakkam (U3, f94r-f98r4 = Indien 28.16).
the Uṇmaippayaṉ Akaval (U3, f98r5-f102v1 = Indien 28.17).
the Ñāṉacukātitam (U3, f102v1-f105r4 = Indien 28.18).
the Pañcākkarakkuṟaḷ (U3, f105r4-f106v = Indien 28.19).
the Ñāṉapūcai (U3, f107r-f109r4 = Indien 28.20).
the Ñāṉacāram (U3, f109r4-f117v3 = Indien 28.21).
the Tiruñāṉacākaram (U3, f113v3-f122v = Indien 28.22).
the Civañāṉacittiyār: Parapakṣam, Cupaṭcam (U3, f181r-f150v = Indien 28.23).
the Civappirakācam (U3, f182r-f192v = Indien 28.24).
the Uṇmaiviḷakkam (U3, f193r-f196r = Indien 28.25).
the Ciṟṟampalanāṭi: Veṇpā, Kalittuṟai, Tāḻicai (U3, f196v-f205r7 = Indien 28.26).
the Mukkālattiraṅkal (U3, f205r8-f210v = Indien 28.27).
the Civānantamālai (U3, f211r-f236v = Indien 28.28).
the Neñcuviṭutūtu (U3, f237r-f242v = Indien 28.29).
the Pañcatikāraviḷakkam (U3, f243r-f249v = Indien 28.30).The folios 250-263 are missing in the bundle. According to the table of contents no. 2 (f[1]v, c1, 4), here was the Oḻiviloṭukkam, which is also found in U3, f300v5-f306v4 (that is, Indien 28.42).
the Tiruñāṉacākaram (U3, f264r-f269v = Indien 28.31).
the Tirukkuṟaḷ (U3, f270r-f276v = Indien 28.32).
the Ñāṉavammāṉai (U3, f227r-f278v = Indien 28.33).
the Tirukkaḷiṟṟuppaṭiyār (U3, f279r-f280r = Indien 28.34).
the Civānantamālai (U3, f281r-f283v1 = Indien 28.35).
the Ñānamaṇamālai (U3, f283v1-f286r4 = Indien 28.36).
the Tirumantiramālai (U3, f286r4-f284v = Indien 28.37).
the Civavākkiyam (U3, f295r-f289v2 = Indien 28.38).
the Tiruvuntiyār (U3, f298v3-f299r3 = Indien 28.39).
the Civaṉantamālaiyil Aṇaintōr Taṉmai (U3, f299r3-f300v5 = Indien 28.40).According to Vinson (1868), here is found the Tirukkaḷiṟṟuppaṭiyār Mūlamum Uraiyum. This appears to be a mistake, found in all versions of Vinson's catalogue, that might be explained by the fact that a previous item in this list is described a such.
the Oḻiviloṭukkam (U3, f300v5-f306v4 = Indien 28.41).
the Palavakai (U3, f306v5-f310v = Indien 28.42).
the Tirumūlar Akaval (U3, f311r-f312r6 = Indien 28.43).
the Piḷḷaiyār Akaval (U3, f312r6-f312v = Indien 28.44).
the Viṉāyakaṉ Iraṭṭai Maṇimālai (U3, f313r-f314r5 = Indien 28.45).
the Tirumurukāṟṟuppaṭai (U3, f314r6- f318v2 = Indien 28.46).
the Paṭṭiṉattuppiḷḷai: Akaval, Neñcoṭu Makiḻtal, Neñcoṭu Tūtu (U3, f318v3-f324v = Indien 28.47).
the Tukaḷaṟupōtam (U3, f325r-f331v = Indien 28.48).
the Ñāṉavaṇṇam (U3, f332r-f334r = Indien 28.49).
the Pūtātikaṇṭappaṟṟu (U3, f335r-f335v7 = Indien 28.50).
the Nāmanaṭṭappaṟṟu (U3, f335v7-f336v = Indien 28.51).
the Kuruvaṟiviḷakkam (U3, f337r-f340r7 = Indien 28.52).
the Aṟivāṉantappaṟṟu (U3, f340r7-f342r1 = Indien 28.53).
the Teḷivuṇmaipōtam (U3, f342r2-f343v3 = Indien 28.54).
the Coṟkēṭṭāmālai (U3, f343v4-f344v3 = Indien 28.55).
the Upatecamālai (U3, f344v4-f347v4 = Indien 28.56).
the Tiruvaṭiviḷakkam (U3, f347v4-f351v7 = Indien 28.57).
the Cōticērviḷakkam (U3, f351v8-f353v = Indien 28.58).
the Pañcamukaccakkaram according to Vinson (1868) (U4, f1-f3 = Indien 28.59): cakkarams (cakra) and mantirams (mantra) of Īśāna, Tatpuruṣa, Aghora, Vāmadeva, and Sadyojāta. This work is not listed in any of the two table of contents.As the height of U4 exceeds by 5 mm that of U3 and as U4 is independently foliated 1-3, it appears that the manuscript is in fact a composite, which for the sake of convenience has been treated here as a multi-text manuscript.
Some works seems to be found twice, but appears to be in fact homonym works by different authors.

Vinson (1868) counts 60 works, of which the no. 60 is missing. This n0. 60 is presumably the work that was written on the folios 250-263, which are missing in the bundle, and was, according to the table of contents no. 2 (f[1]v, c1, 4), the Oḻiviloṭukkam.

The texts are preceded by two additional tables of contents, both incomplete and both with black pencil additions:
Table of contents n0. 1 (U1). The total stanzas are given for each mentioned text. This table stops at Indien 28.27. An addition in black pencils lists Indien 28.55 to Indien 28.58 which are missing in table of contents n0. 2
Table of contents n0. 2 (U2). The first and last foliation are given for each mentioned text. This table stops at Indien 28.54. The recto and verso are inverted in the bundle as it is.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Table of Contents no. 1 (additional). No foliation. 305 x 40 mm.
1 folio = Table of Contents n0. 2 (additional). No foliation. 305 x 40 mm.
339 folios = 58 works. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-249, 264-285, 287-353. From f266, the foliation is by another hand. 305 x 45 mm.
3 folios = Pañcamukaccakkaram. Tamil foliation 1-3. 305 x 50 mm.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 28 (front cover, recto). Covering an earlier sticker.
BnF bequest sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF. 305 x 45 mm.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not dated by Vinson (1868) nor by Cabaton (1912).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177). Ariel manuscript not acknowledged by Cabaton (1912).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 6, no. 28.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. (1866-). Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 8r = p. 8 , no. 28.

Vinson, Julien (1868). Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 8, no. 28. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — Vinson reads: வே. ௬௰, but this information is no more found in the bundle. It is possible taht it was on a title page folio, now lost, of the type usually found with Ariel manuscripts, providing the total and the list of works contained in the bundle.

p.p: Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only).
c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
